Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rh-mongodb30upg
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: rh-mongodb30upg
Vulnerability.Description:
New rh-mongodb30upg packages are now available as a part of Red Hat Software Collections 2.2 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. The Mongodb 3.0 upgrade Software Collection contains a limited version of MongoDB 3.0.11 to provide an upgrade path from MongoDB 2.6 to MongoDB 3.2 for customers with existing MongoDB databases. This Software Collection includes neither MongoDB Java Driver nor MongoDB Tools.
This enhancement update adds the rh-mongodb30upg packages to Red Hat Software Collections. (BZ#1301154)
For details, see the Red Hat Software Collections 2.2 Release Notes linked from the References section.
All users who require rh-mongodb30upg are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
